description: This foundation course explores major principles of cellular and molecular biology and is a
prerequisite for all Level II biology courses. Emphases include the structural and chemical
composition of cells, crucial metabolic pathways, fundamentals of cell division, basic
genetics, and the scientific method. Materials integrate concepts with problem-solving. Students
are introduced to state-of-the-art library search technologies and scientific writing. Students
attend lectures plus one 2.5-hour laboratory per week. Offered Fall Semester and during Interim.
